intro: Camellia euphlebia var. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan camellia, is a species native to China, particularly in the Yunnan province. It is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to 5 meters tall, featuring broad, glossy leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces striking red or pink flowers during the winter months, which are borne on short pedicels. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and requires partial shade to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its role in the Camellia genus.
